entry.title: Webinar | Dec 14 | Advanced Cloud-Native Deployment Strategies
entry.summary: Hosted by BoxBoat on December 14, 2021, 2pm - 3:30pm Eastern Time Zone Are you using Kubernetes but still deploying…
entry.content:
Hosted by BoxBoat on December 14, 2021, 2pm - 3:30pm Eastern Time Zone

Are you using Kubernetes but still deploying application changes to production once per sprint, once per month, or once per a couple of months? Something is wrong.

It's been found through several years of industry-wide reports that elite DevOps practitioners deploy on-demand (1+ per day) to production, regardless of industry. What's exciting is that if you're using Kubernetes, you have a lot of the capabilities to safely deploy at an increased frequency.

In this webinar, you will learn various deployment strategies so that you can stop with the 50+ person deployment meetings, endless deployment checklists, release trains, and mind-numbing dependency tracking.

Learn more and register here!

entry.title: New Service | Azure Load Testing
entry.summary: On November 30th the Microsoft Azure Dev Tools team announced the preview of a new Azure Load Testing service. Azure…
entry.content:
On November 30th the Microsoft Azure Dev Tools team announced the preview of a new Azure Load Testing service. Azure Load Testing is a fully managed Azure service that enables developers and testers to generate high-scale load with custom Apache JMeter scripts.  That's right, you can use your existing experience and knowledge with one of the most popular open-source load testing tools with Azure Load Testing.

Get started by first reading the announcement post,  check out the preview documentation and then create your first load test!

entry.title: Webinar | Dec 8 | Embracing Hybrid Work with Microsoft Teams

entry.content:
Embracing hybrid work with new Microsoft Teams innovations for Government
2 pm Eastern | 11 am Pacific

Connect, engage, and empower your team to work together in the hybrid reality.

Hybrid work is here. As governments begin to re-open in many regions across the United States, many can’t wait to get back to in-person collaboration. To succeed in this transition, organizations need to build a new operating model for their people, locations, and processes.

Microsoft Teams is mission-critical for a more flexible world of work. New innovations deliver more natural meeting experiences and empower everyone to use hybrid work tools to the fullest.

Join us in this webinar to find new ways to connect and engage regardless of location and time zone. You will learn how to:

  • Use new Microsoft Teams features for more engaging meetings
  • Bring together meetings, chat, calls, collaboration, and business process automation.
  • Enable people to connect seamlessly with those inside and outside of their organizations, ensuring all voices are heard.
  • Provide ways to make remote presentations richer and more impactful.

Experts will be ready to take and answer your questions during the webinar.

Get ready for the future of work with help from Microsoft.

entry.title: Webinar | Nov 18 | Databricks Batch and Streaming
entry.summary: November 18, 2pm ET hosted by Wintellect Databricks is a leading big data processing service available on Azure. One of…
entry.content:
November 18, 2pm ET hosted by Wintellect

Databricks is a leading big data processing service available on Azure. One of the nicest features in Databricks is the ability to develop workloads that run in batch or streaming modes.

In this webinar, Wintellect will review the basics of a notebook running in batch mode. In this example, we’ll be focusing on Delta Tables for our sinks. You will learn the differences between batch and streaming and just how easy it is to convert a notebook to streaming mode. We’ll also review streaming limitations within Databricks. Finally, we will walk you through an example of how to develop a job that can be parameterized to run a notebook in both modes.

entry.title: Expert Panel | Dec 1 | Azure DevOps & GitHub - Better Together
entry.summary: 12:00pm - 1:30pm PT / 3:00pm - 4:30pm ET Join us for a private virtual Azure DevOps & GitHub event…
entry.content:
12:00pm - 1:30pm PT / 3:00pm - 4:30pm ET

Join us for a private virtual Azure DevOps & GitHub event with an expert panel featuring Atmosera's Ken Muse, VP of Professional Services, and DevOps Ranger, Heather Brevard, Sr. Azure App Innovation Specialist from Microsoft, and Robert Freeman, PMP, CTO, Public Sector from GitHub to discuss the benefits of incorporating GitHub into your current DevOps practice.

With Microsoft acquiring GitHub, many teams struggle to understand whether to adopt GitHub or Azure DevOps, especially if there is already an investment in Azure DevOps or Team Foundation Server (TFS). There is a third option that's often overlooked – the integration of both platforms!
